results.title: Depart de Grandes Vacances
results.brief_description: A sequel to “La Famille Marin” a language training film in which the sound track records conversations and commentary is simple French Everyday expressions and simple vocabulary are used throughout the film. The Martin family is shown preparing to do on a holiday. The various members are seen packing with greater or less success. The luggage is safely stowed with one omission - the luncheon basket is left behind, unnoticed on the pavement. The misadventures of the family are followed throughout their holiday excursion.

results.title: Dental health - how and why
results.brief_description: A review of what research and experimentation have done to promote better dental health for the American public, including a report on diet and its relation to the growth and decay on teeth, new sodium fluoride applications and the latest techniques of oral hygiene. Shows different types of teeth, the effect of chewing on a tooth, the correct techniques of cleaning teeth.

results.title: Dental caries in South Africa
results.creator_credit: South Africa. Dept. of Education. Film Services Union
results.brief_description: The film depicts the incidence of the disease in various parts of South Africa, and deals with the following aspects: effects of fluoride; mottling and hypoplasia, contributory causes of decay; preventive measures; correct methods of brushing the teeth; correct diet; regular dental examination.

results.title: Dennis O'Rourke: Filmmaker
results.creator_credit: AFTRS and Television and Radio School
results.brief_description: Dennis O’Rourke talks to Peter Thompson about his film “Cannibal Tours”. He discusses moral issues concerning the cultures of Western tourists and the people of Papua New Guinea.

results.title: Dennis Lillee
results.creator_credit: John E. Bodnar and BBC Enterprises
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cricketing legends”.
One of cricket’s greatest bowlers, with his thick moustache and bristling aggression, Dennis Lillee was both brilliant and charismatic. His new ball partnership with Jeff Thomson was, perhaps, the most feared in the modern game. Courageous, controversial, and always determined, Lillee overcame serious injury to complete a very distinguished career. This program includes a contribution from Rod Marsh who caught 95 catches from Lillee’s bowling.

results.title: Denmark: [Paul Henningsen]
results.brief_description: A visual interpretation of the pattern and tempo of life in Denmark. Observes fishermen hauling in the catch; loading and unloading of cargo at the dock; farmers bringing their products to market and lighter side of life - holiday making and fun at the local carnival.
results.description: A visual interpretation of the pattern and tempo of life in Denmark. Observes fishermen hauling in the catch; loading and unloading of cargo at the dock; farmers bringing their products to market and lighter side of life - holiday making and fun at the local carnival.

results.title: Denmark
results.brief_description: A geographical film which deals with the commercial life and work of the Danes. It covers farming, shipyards, engineering, timber-working, matchmaking, boxing, and porcelain.

results.title: Denmark
results.brief_description: Denmark yesterday and today. After giving an idea of the appearance of Denmark the film outlines its history, showing burial mounds of the Bronze Age, and the appearance of churches and other buildings at different times. Also includes footage of the industries, sports and social services of Denmark today; views of Copenhagen; and the coronation of King Frederick.

results.title: Denial
results.creator_credit: Victorian College of the Arts and Phillip Crawford
results.brief_description: Kane is a 14-year old with a plan. Using his brother as bait, he steals some money off a man with a model train-set. But the plan goes wrong. If Kane is not careful the things that he wants to keep hidden will be let out. This film deals with the issue of sexual abuse through the eyes of a teenage boy who wants to forget. A very real and powerful portrayl of human nature. (Awards: Winner of the Southern Star Award for Best Film, Winner ATOM Awards 1998 Best Tertiary Short Fiction)
